p:
However, Guillen and Uriate (2012)
33 found that the predominant trans-2-alkenals and n-alkanals detected in the headspace of extra-virgin olive oil heated at a temperature of 190 °C for 20 hr. in a stainless steel frying tank were n-nonanal, and a combination of trans-2-decenal and -undecenal, respectively (with significantly higher levels of trans-2-decenal than trans-2-undecenal being observed). Similar results were found by Fullana et al. in 2004
34 , who also observed much lower headspace concentrations of peroxidised linoleoylglycerol-derived trans, trans-alka-2,4-dienals than those of trans-2-alkenals and n-alkanals for olive oil when thermally-stressed at 180 °C for a period of 15 hr. in a closed Pyrex Instatherm reaction flask and head.
